text: Pascal Kané (January 21, 1946 in Angoulême – August 31, 2020) was a French movie director, screenwriter and actor. He was on the editorial staff of Cahiers du Cinéma from 1969 to 1979.Artecinema website , accessed 15 April 2011 He taught cinema at Université Paris III.Pschitt Info website, Arnaud Desplechin article , accessed 15 April 2011 He was known for directing and writing Liberty Belle. He starred in India Song and The Suspended Vocation. He was born in Angoulême, Charente. Kané died on August 31, 2020 at the age of 74.Hommage à Pascal Kané ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1946 births Category:2020 deaths Category:French movie actors Category:French movie directors Category:French screenwriters Category:Academics of Paris universities Category:People from Angoulême
title: Pascal Kané
